intro: Guazuma ulmifolia var. trianae, commonly known as the Trianas guazuma, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is often found in moist, lowland forests and can grow up to 20 meters in height. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small seeds, aiding in its dispersal. The species is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
